author: .mindey
content:
Hello, everyone, my name is Mindey, and I'm just a curious random process that wants to explore and optimize all universes ‚òÜ (originally got to know about b-money in 2007, on weidai.com, searching Google for answer to Q: "How to create a universe, where everything could exist?", as he's got a mailing list on similar topic), and I've contributed to original genesis sale, because I liked Gavin's paper. However, I have lost access to my `3325.11 ETH` from that sale, that I bought on `ethereum.org` website, and here is the issue on the website's repo (https://github.com/ethereum/ethereum-org-website/issues/3069). Given that Ethereum was developed as a really flexible system, I'm looking for a way to create oracles-based smart contract for the recovery based on facts that remained in various other systems and databases to construct a proof beyond reasonable doubt, because I still have private key of the Bitcoin address that I used to credit my account on Cryptsy.com, from which I made the contributions, and I still have its user password, still have Gmail account that I got confirmation e-mails from ethereum.org, and still got those memories in my neurons as well. This experience made me think, how human != private key, and come up with the idea of CRISPR-Hash Pills (CRISPR-hash pill ( https://0oo.li/event/23/hash-pill )), that would deterministically tie identity with one's unique biological processes. While not a thing that could solve my problem, but a thing that could prevent future problems like mine. There is a saying: records matter scientifically, even if they are not on any blockchain -- records on various databases, records on people's minds, etc., they can be difference between life and death (as described in this video https://youtu.be/iVrQqWIs6ZE ). And it seems it is my case here too, because I've contributed, but I'm left with nothing.

What is the best channel to discuss the idea of _Smart Contract for Recovery of Genesis Ether Sold On Etherum.org_?

author: .mindey
content: <@456226577798135808> I hope so, and <@!552133098075193354> , I've posted it on Ethereum-Magicians (topic: https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/ethereum-org-genesis-ether-recovery-smart-contracts-based-on-oracles-for-identity-proving/6270/), and got to know that community is not ready for it yet: there is _EIP-867 (Standardized Ethereum Recovery Proposals)_, but as <@!221567393539817472> said, _"There is no desire to introduce a mechanism into the protocol that allows for stuck funds to be recovered. "_ :( It may look negligible to the community in the grand scheme of things, because such cases are few, but perhaps, once identity-based recovery becomes a standard practice, this issue will be revisited? After all, physical human != ether private key...
